did.unittitle: Edwin Franko Goldman Autograph Collection circa 1770-1954, 1850s-1940s
did.abstract: Edwin Franko Goldman (1878-1956) was an American composer and conductor for military bands. Collection, assembled by Goldman, of autographs, letters, photographs, and musical scores of many musical celebrities from his lifetime and before.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by the University of Michigan Band in 1995. Donor no. 7024

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no, Edwin Franko Goldman Autograph Collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Edwin Franko Goldman (1878-1956) was an American composer and conductor for military bands. As an avocation, he was also a collector of autographs, letters, photographs, and musical scores of many musical celebrities from his lifetime and before. In May 1954 he donated his collection to University of Michigan band director William Revelli for use by the band. The "Edwin Franko Goldman Room" in Harris Hall at the University of Michigan was dedicated to display the collection.

scopecontent.p: The Edwin Franko Goldman Autograph Collection consists of two series: Background Materials and Autographed Photographs and Manuscripts. The collection contains autographs, letters, photographs, and musical scores of such notable musical celebrities as Antonin Dvorák, George Gershwin, Franz Liszt, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, John Philip Sousa, Johann Strauss, and Igor Stravinsky.
Background Materials, consists of a single scrapbook of photographs, newspaper clippings and other materials related to the dedication of the Goldman Room in 1954.

odd.p: (consisting of news clippings, photographs and memorabilia documenting Goldman's appearance as guest conductor of the U of M Symphony Band, his stay in Ann Arbor and the dedication of Goldman Room)

scopecontent.p: Autographed Photographs and Manuscripts, consists of autographs, letters, photographs and musical scores of musical celebrities. Materials have been arranged alphabetically. Oversized materials are located in Box 2 of the collection.
